plugins.name: authz-keycloak
plugins.description: An authorization plugin to be used with the Keycloak Identity Server

plugins.name: basic-auth
plugins.description: An authentication plugin that need to work with consumer to add Basic Authentication to a Service or a Route

plugins.name: hmac-auth
plugins.description: An authentication plugin that need to work with consumer to establish the integrity of incoming requests

plugins.name: jwt-auth
plugins.description: An authentication plugin that need to work with consumer to securely authenticate a valid user requesting access

plugins.name: key-auth
plugins.description: An authentication plugin that need to work with consumer to add key authentication to your Services

plugins.name: openid-connect
plugins.description: An authentication plugin that provides authentication and introspection capability to APISIX

plugins.name: api-breaker
plugins.description: The plugin implements API fuse functionality to help us protect our upstream business services

plugins.name: consumer-restriction
plugins.description: The plugin makes corresponding access restrictions based on different objects selected

plugins.name: cors
plugins.description: The plugin can help you enable CORS easily

plugins.name: fault-injection
plugins.description: The plugin provides the ability to deliberately cause a service to fail, in order to test failure in a complex distributed solution

plugins.name: ip-restriction
plugins.description: The ip-restriction can restrict access to a Service or a Route by either whitelisting or blacklisting IP addresses

plugins.name: referer-restriction
plugins.description: The referer-restriction can restrict access to a Service or a Route by whitelisting request header Referrers

plugins.name: request-validation
plugins.description: The request-validation plugin validates the requests before forwarding to an upstream service

plugins.name: uri-blocker
plugins.description: The plugin helps to intercept user requests

plugins.name: limit-conn
plugins.description: The plugin  Limits request concurrency

plugins.name: limit-count
plugins.description: The plugin Limits request rate by a fixed number of requests in a given time window

plugins.name: limit-req
plugins.description: The plugin limits request rate using the eaky bucket method

plugins.name: traffic-split
plugins.description: The traffic split plugin allows users to incrementally direct percentages of traffic between various upstreams

plugins.name: serverless-pre-function
plugins.description: The serverless-pre-function runs at the beginning of the specified phase

plugins.name: serverless-post-function
plugins.description: The serverless-post-function runs at the end of the specified phase

plugins.name: error-log-logger
plugins.description: Error-log-logger is a plugin which pushes the log data of APISIX's error.log to TCP servers

plugins.name: http-logger
plugins.description: Http-logger is a plugin which push Log data requests to HTTP/HTTPS servers

plugins.name: kafka-logger
plugins.description: Kafka-logger is a plugin which works as a Kafka client driver for the ngx_lua nginx module

plugins.name: prometheus
plugins.description: The plugin exposes metrics in Prometheus Exposition format

plugins.name: request-id
plugins.description: The plugin adds a unique ID (UUID) to each request proxied through APISIX

plugins.name: skywalking
plugins.description: Skywalking uses its native Nginx LUA tracer to provide tracing, topology analysis, and metrics from service and URI perspective

plugins.name: sls-logger
plugins.description: Sls-logger pushes Log data requests to ali cloud Log Server with RF5424

plugins.name: syslog
plugins.description: Sys pushes Log data requests to Syslog

plugins.name: tcp-logger
plugins.description: Tcp-logger pushes Log data requests to TCP servers

plugins.name: udp-logger
plugins.description: Udp-logger pushes Log data requests to UDP servers

plugins.name: zipkin
plugins.description: Zipkin is a OpenTracing plugin

plugins.name: batch-requests
plugins.description: Batch-requests accepts multiple request and send them from apisix via http pipeline

plugins.name: grpc-transcode
plugins.description: Grpc-transcoding involves mapping HTTP/JSON requests and their parameters to gRPC methods and their parameters and return types

plugins.name: proxy-cache
plugins.description: The proxy-cache plugin provides the ability to cache upstream response data and can be used with other plugins

plugins.name: proxy-mirror
plugins.description: TThe proxy-mirror plugin provides the ability to mirror client requests

plugins.name: proxy-rewrite
plugins.description: The proxy-rewrite is an upstream proxy information rewriting plugin

plugins.name: response-rewrite
plugins.description: Response-rewrite rewrites the content returned by the upstream as well as Apache APISIX itself

plugins.name: wolf-rbac
plugins.description: Wolf-rbac is an authentication and authorization (rbac) plugin where the rbac feature is provided by wolf

plugins.name: client-control
plugins.description: The client-control plugin dynamically controls the behavior of Nginx to handle the client request

plugins.name: ext-plugin-pre-req
plugins.description: The ext-plugin-pre-req runs specific external plugins in the plugin runner, before executing most of the builtin Lua plugins

plugins.name: ext-plugin-post-req
plugins.description: The ext-plugin-post-req runs after executing builtin Lua plugins and before proxying to the upstream
